ayas.translation: By the [angels] ranged in ranks,
by the ones who drive [the clouds] vigorously,
by the ones who recite the reminder:
indeed your God is certainly One,

ayas.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
ayas.translation: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and the Lord of the easts.
ayas.transliteration: rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā warabbul mashāriq

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
ayas.translation: Indeed We have adorned the lowest heaven with the finery of the stars,
and to guard from any froward devil.

ayas.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
ayas.translation: They do not eavesdrop on the Supernal Elite—they are shot at from every side,
ayas.transliteration: lā yassamma`ūna ilal-mala-il-a`lā wayuqdhafūna min kulli jānib

ayas.translation: to drive them away, and there is a perpetual punishment for them—

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
ayas.translation: except any who snatches a snatch, whereat a piercing flame pursues him.
ayas.transliteration: illā man khaṭifal khaṭfata fa-atba`ahu shihābun thāqib

ayas.arabic: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍۭ
ayas.translation: Ask them, is their creation more prodigious or [that of other creatures] that We have created? Indeed, We created them from a viscous clay.
ayas.transliteration: fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnā ۚ innā khalaqnāhum min ṭīnin lāzib

ayas.translation: Indeed you wonder, while they engage in ridicule,
and [even] when admonished do not take admonition,
and when they see a sign they make it an object of ridicule,

ayas.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayas.translation: and say, ‘This is nothing but plain magic!’
ayas.transliteration: waqālū in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīn

ayas.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
ayas.translation: ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?
ayas.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

ayas.translation: And our forefathers too?!’
Say, ‘Yes! And you will be utterly humble.’

ayas.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
ayas.translation: It will be only a single shout and, behold, they will look on,
ayas.transliteration: fa-innamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun fa-idhā hum yanẓurūn

ayas.translation: and say, ‘Woe to us! This is the Day of Retribution!’

ayas.arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayas.translation: ‘This is the Day of Judgement that you used to deny!’
ayas.transliteration: hādhā yawmul faṣlil ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

ayas.arabic: ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: ‘Muster the wrongdoers and their mates and what they used to worship
ayas.transliteration: uḥ-shurul ladhīna ẓalamū wa-azwājahum wa mā kānū ya`budūn

ayas.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: besides Allah, and show them the way to hell!
ayas.transliteration: min dūnillāhi fahdūhum ilā ṣirāṭil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: [But first] stop them! For they must be questioned.’
‘Why is it that you do not support one another [today]?’
‘Indeed, they are [meek and] submissive today!’
Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

ayas.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayas.translation: They will say, ‘Indeed you used to accost us peremptorily.’
They will answer, ‘No, you [yourselves] had no faith.

ayas.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَـٰغِينَ
ayas.translation: We had no authority over you. No, you [yourselves] were a rebellious lot.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā kāna lanā `alaykum min sulṭān ۖ bal kuntum qawman ṭāghīn

ayas.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
ayas.translation: So our Lord’s word became due against us that we shall indeed taste [the punishment].
So we perverted you, for we were perverse [ourselves].’
So, that day they will share the punishment.
Indeed, that is how We deal with the guilty.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
ayas.translation: Indeed, it was they who, when they were told, ‘There is no god except Allah,’ used to be disdainful,
ayas.transliteration: innahum kānū idhā qīla lahum lā ilāha illallāhu yastakbirūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
ayas.translation: and [they would] say, ‘Shall we abandon our gods for a crazy poet?’
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlūna a-innā latārikū ālihatinā lishā`irin majnūn

ayas.translation: Indeed, he has brought [them] the truth, and confirmed the [earlier] apostles.
ayas.transliteration: bal jā-a bil ḥaqqi waṣaddaqal mursalīn

ayas.translation: Indeed you will taste the painful punishment,

ayas.arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: and you will be requited only for what you used to do
ayas.transliteration: wa mā tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

ayas.translation: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.
For such there is a known provision
—fruits—and they will be held in honour,
in the gardens of bliss,
[reclining] on couches, facing one another,
served around with a cup, from a clear fountain,
snow-white, delicious to the drinkers,

ayas.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
ayas.translation: wherein there will be neither headache nor will it cause them stupefaction,
ayas.transliteration: lā fīhā ghawlun walā hum `anhā yunzafūn

ayas.translation: and with them will be maidens, of restrained glances with big [beautiful] eyes,
as if they were hidden ostrich eggs.
Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

ayas.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
ayas.translation: One of them will say, ‘Indeed I had a companion
ayas.transliteration: qāla qā-ilun minhum innī kāna lī qarīn

ayas.translation: who used to say, ‘‘Are you really among those who affirm

ayas.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
ayas.translation: that when we have died and become dust and bones, we shall be brought to retribution?’’ ’
ayas.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamadīnūn

ayas.translation: He will say, ‘Will you have a look?’
Then he will take a look and sight him in the middle of hell.
He will say, ‘By Allah, you had almost ruined me!

ayas.arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
ayas.translation: Had it not been for my Lord’s blessing, I too would have been among those mustered [in hell]!’
ayas.transliteration: walawlā ni`matu rabbī lakuntu minal muḥḍarīn

ayas.translation: ‘Is it [true] that we shall not die [anymore],

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
ayas.translation: aside from our earlier death, and that we shall not be punished?
ayas.transliteration: illā mawtatanal-ūlā wa mā naḥnu bimu`adhhabīn

ayas.translation: This is indeed the supreme triumph!’
Let all workers work for the like of this!

ayas.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
ayas.translation: Is this a better reception, or the Zaqqum tree?
ayas.transliteration: adhālika khayrun nuzulan am shajaratuz zaqqūm

ayas.translation: Indeed We have made it a punishment for the wrongdoers.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: It is a tree that rises from the depths of hell.
ayas.transliteration: innahā shajaratun takhruju fī aṣlil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: Its spathes are as if they were devils’ heads.

ayas.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
ayas.translation: They will eat from it and gorge with it their bellies.
ayas.transliteration: fa-innahum la-ākilūna minhā famāli-ūna minhal buṭūn

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
ayas.translation: On top of that they will take a solution of scalding water.
ayas.transliteration: thumma inna lahum `alayhā lashawban min ḥamīm

ayas.translation: Then their retreat will be toward hell.
They had found their fathers astray,
yet they press onwards in their footsteps.
Most of the former peoples went astray before them,
and We had certainly sent warners among them.
So observe how was the fate of those who were warned
—[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants!
Certainly Noah called out to Us, and how well did We respond!
We delivered him and his family from their great distress,
and made his descendants the survivors,
and left for him a good name among posterity:
‘Peace to Noah, throughout the nations!’
Thus do We reward the virtuous.
He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.
Then We drowned the rest.
Indeed Abraham was among his followers,
when he came to his Lord with a sound heart [untainted by sin].

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: When he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mādhā ta`budūn

ayas.translation: Is it a lie, gods other than Allah, that you desire?
Then what is your idea about the Lord of all the worlds?’
Then he made an observation of the stars
and said, ‘Indeed I am sick!’
So they went away leaving him behind.

ayas.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
ayas.translation: Then he stole away to their gods and said, ‘Will you not eat?
ayas.transliteration: farāgha ilā ālihatihim faqāla alā ta-kulūn

ayas.translation: Why do you not speak?’
Then he attacked them, striking forcefully.
They came running towards him.
He said, ‘Do you worship what you have yourselves carved,
when Allah has created you and whatever you make?’

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Build a structure for him and cast him into a huge fire.’
ayas.transliteration: qālub-nū lahu bunyānan fa-alqūhu fil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: So they sought to outwit him, but We made them the lowermost.

ayas.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Indeed I am going toward my Lord, who will guide me.’
ayas.transliteration: waqāla innī dhāhibun ilā rabbī sayahdīn

ayas.translation: ‘My Lord! Give me [an heir], one of the righteous.’
So We gave him the good news of a forbearing son.

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: When he was old enough to assist in his endeavour, he said, ‘My son! I see in dreams that I am sacrificing you. See what you think.’ He said, ‘Father! Do whatever you have been commanded. If Allah wishes, you will find me to be patient.’
ayas.transliteration: falammā balagha ma`ahus sa`ya qāla yābunayya innī arā fil manāmi annī adhbaḥuka fanẓur mādhā tarā ۚ qāla yā-abatif-`al mā tu-mar ۖ satajidunī in shā-allāhu minaṣ ṣābirīn

ayas.translation: So when they had both surrendered [to Allah’s will], and he had laid him down on his forehead,
We called out to him, ‘O Abraham!

ayas.arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
ayas.translation: You have indeed fulfilled your vision! Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous!
ayas.transliteration: qad ṣaddaqtar ru-yā ۚ innā kadhālika najzil muḥsinīn

ayas.translation: This was indeed a manifest test.’
Then We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
and left for him a good name in posterity:
‘Peace be to Abraham!’
Thus do We reward the virtuous.
He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.
And We gave him the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

ayas.arabic: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
ayas.translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants [some] are virtuous, and [some] who manifestly wrong themselves.
ayas.transliteration: wabāraknā `alayhi wa`alā is-ḥāq ۚ wa min dhurriyyatihimā muḥsinun waẓālimul linafsihi mubīn

ayas.translation: Certainly We favoured Moses and Aaron,
and delivered them and their people from their great distress,
and We helped them so that they became the victors.
We gave them the illuminating scripture
and guided them to the straight path,
and left for them a good name in posterity.
‘Peace be to Moses and Aaron!’
Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.
They are indeed among Our faithful servants.
Indeed Ilyas was one of the apostles.
When he said to his people, ‘Will you not be Godwary?
Do you invoke Baal and abandon the best of creators,
Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?,’
they impugned him. So they will indeed be mustered [in hell]
—[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.
We left for him a good name in posterity.
‘Peace be to Ilyas!’
Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.
He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.
Indeed Lot was one of the apostles.
When We delivered him and all his family,
excepting an old woman among those who remained behind,
We destroyed the rest.
Indeed you pass by them at dawn
and at night. Do you not exercise your reason?
Indeed Jonah was one of the apostles.
When he absconded toward the laden ship,
he drew lots with them and was the one to be condemned [as one to be thrown overboard].
Then the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy.
Had he not been one of those who celebrate Allah’s glory,

ayas.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
ayas.translation: he would have surely remained in its belly till the day they will be resurrected.
ayas.transliteration: lalabitha fī baṭnihi ilā yawmi yub`athūn

ayas.translation: Then We cast him on a bare shore, and he was sick.
So We made a gourd plant grow above him.

ayas.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
ayas.translation: We sent him to a [community of] hundred thousand or more,
ayas.transliteration: wa-arsalnāhu ilā mī-ati alfin aw yazīdūn

ayas.translation: and they believed [in him]. So We provided for them for a while.
Ask them, are daughters to be for your Lord while sons are to be for them?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَـٰثًا وَهُمْ شَـٰهِدُونَ
ayas.translation: Did We create the angels females while they were present?
ayas.transliteration: am khalaqnal malā-ikata ināthan wahum shāhidūn

ayas.translation: Be aware that it is out of their mendacity that they say,
‘Allah has begotten [offsprings],’ and they indeed speak a falsehood.
Has He preferred daughters to sons?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Will you not then take admonition?
Do you have a manifest authority?
Then produce your scripture, should you be truthful.

ayas.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
ayas.translation: And they have set up a kinship between Him and the jinn, while the jinn certainly know that they will be presented [before Him].
ayas.transliteration: waja`alū baynahu wabaynal jinnati nasabā ۚ walaqad `alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuḥḍarūn

ayas.translation: Clear is Allah of whatever they allege [about Him]
—[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.
Indeed you and what you worship
cannot mislead [anyone] about Him,
except someone who is bound for hell.

ayas.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
ayas.translation: ‘There is none among us but has a known place.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā minnā illā lahu maqāmun ma`lūm

ayas.translation: It is we who are the ranged ones.
It is we who celebrate Allah’s glory.’
They indeed, used to say,

ayas.arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: ‘Had we possessed a Reminder from our predecessors,
we would have surely been Allah’s exclusive servants.’
But they disbelieved it [when it came to them]. Soon they will know!
Certainly Our decree has gone beforehand in favour of Our servants, the apostles,
that they will indeed receive [Allah’s] help,
and indeed Our hosts will be the victors.
So leave them alone for a while,
and watch them; soon they will see [the truth of the matter]!
Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?

ayas.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
ayas.translation: But when it descends in their courtyard it will be a dismal dawn for those who had been warned.
ayas.transliteration: fa-idhā nazala bisāḥatihim fasā-a ṣabāḥul mundharīn

ayas.translation: So leave them alone for a while,
and watch; soon they will see!

ayas.arabic: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
ayas.translation: Clear is your Lord, the Lord of Might, of whatever they allege [concerning Him].
Peace be to the apostles!
All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of all the worlds.
